issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: FifoScheduler incorrectly checking for node locality

comments.body: Please review this patch for the fix plus a unit test case
The attached patch makes a very simple fix to FifoScheduler and adds a unit test to verify it.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12570342/YARN-412.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

  {color:red}-1 one of tests included doesn't have a timeout.{color}

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Hi Arun,

I'm guessing you assigned this to me on accident so I'm assigning it to you.  Let me know if there's anything I can do.
[~theduderog] - No, you deserve credit for finding and fixing this. Thanks!
[~theduderog] Unfortunately, the patch doesn't apply anymore... could you please re-gen it? Thanks, and sorry for losing track of this and asking for a rebase!
Regenerated patch to svn version 1463033
Resubmitting patch based on svn r1463033
[~acmurthy] OK.  I've regenerated the patch based on the top of tree.  Finger crossed, it still passes all QA checks.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

    {color:red}-1 javac{color:red}.  The patch appears to cause the build to fail.

This message is automatically generated.
Trying one more time since the eclipse target failed on Hadoop Common, a package I did not touch.

@Roger, for future reference ( may not be applicable to this jira ), it is good to leave earlier patch attachments lying around and not delete them when uploading newer patches. This can be used to trace review comments/feedback etc.

As for hadoop-common, mvn eclipse:eclipse, it can be ignored for now. It is a known issue with an open jira that has not been addressed yet.
Thank you, [~hitesh].  I think this patch is ready to go now.  What's the next step?

Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #3607 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/3607/])
    YARN-412. Fixed FifoScheduler to check hostname of a NodeManager rather than its host:port during scheduling which caused incorrect locality for containers. Contributed by Roger Hoover. (Revision 1467244)

     Result = SUCCESS
